a written notice to Members of Parliament from their party leaders telling them that they must be present at a particular vote and must vote in a particular way
having or causing problems or difficulties

examples.x: a tough childhood

During the interview I was asked some really tough questions.
Now Karen must make one of the toughest choices of her life.
She's been having a tough time of it (= a lot of problems) lately.
Times are tough at the moment.
We've got a tough fight ahead.
He faces the toughest test of his leadership so far.
What was the toughest job you ever had?
a tough task
It can be tough trying to juggle a career and a family.
He faces tough competition from the rest of the team.
Puberty can be tough on kids.
I knew she was going to be tough to beat.

senses.definition: demanding that particular rules be obeyed and showing a lack of sympathy for any problems that this may cause

examples.x: It's about time teachers started to get tough with bullies.

Don't be too tough on him—he was only trying to help.

senses.definition: strong enough to deal successfully with difficult conditions or situations

examples.x: a tough breed of cattle

senses.definition: physically strong and likely to be violent

examples.x: You think you're so tough, don't you?

senses.definition: with a lot of crime or violence

examples.x: She grew up in a tough neighbourhood.

senses.definition: difficult to cut or bite on

examples.x: The meat was a bit tough.

senses.definition: not easily cut, broken, torn, etc.

examples.x: a tough pair of shoes

senses.definition: unlucky for somebody in a way that seems unfair

examples.x: It was tough on her being dropped from the team like that.

senses.definition: to become or make something stronger, so that it is not easily cut, broken, etc.

examples.x: toughened glass

senses.definition: to make something such as laws or rules stricter

examples.x: The government is considering toughening up the law on censorship.

senses.definition: to make somebody stronger and more able to deal with difficult situations

examples.x: His parents sent him away to school to toughen him up.

senses.definition: not allowed by the law Unlawful

examples.x: He was convicted of unlawful possession of a firearm.

senses.definition: in a way that is not allowed by the law Unlawfully

examples.x: Any person who unlawfully kills another is guilty of a crime, which is called murder or manslaughter, according to the circumstances of the case.

senses.definition: a thick liquid that is eaten with food to add taste to it

examples.x: tomato/cranberry/chilli sauce
chicken in a white sauce
ice cream with a hot fudge sauce
pasta sauce (= sauce that is served with pasta)

coconut tart served with hot chocolate sauce

senses.definition: talk or behaviour that is annoying or shows no respect
the result of an exam in which a person is not successful

examples.x: I got three passes and one fail.

senses.definition: a mistake or lack of success in doing something

examples.x: The show was an epic fail.
